results.title: Backroads
results.brief_description: The story of two men on the run from the police in outback NSW, Backroads was the first feature film in which First Peoples made a major creative contribution, other than fine acting.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.description:
The story of two men on the run from the police in outback NSW, Backroads was the first feature film in which First Peoples made a major creative contribution, other than fine acting. The dialogue between the two main characters elevates the film into an angry polemical statement about white responsibility for the poverty and destitution of Indigenous people. Essie Coffey, playing herself, talks about her people’s struggle for land rights.

Also stars Gary Foley, Bill Hunter and Julie McGregor and features photography by Russell Boyd.
description_for_label:

results.title: Lady and the Tramp
results.creator_credit: Wilfred Jackson, Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Lady, a pampered cocker spaniel, and Tramp, a jaunty mutt with a heart of gold, join an equally delightful cast of characters for an animated masterpiece. It’s an enthralling story, breathtaking animation and memorable songs, (written and performed by the legendary Peggy Lee) provide unparalleled romance, adventure and enchantment. Rated: G

results.title: The Great Land of Small
results.brief_description: Tonight, in a quiet forest, Jenny and David are about to embark on a mystical, magical adventure. Aided by Fritz, a kindly hobbit like creature, they are about to enter the enchanted World of Small. Once inside, the kids discover the Kingdom of Small is a place of beauty and wonder and happiness, where no one grows old. Unfortunately, Jenny and David are told that they cannot return home and only Fritz’s special magic can help them. Rated: G

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Ken Hughes, Albert R. Broccoli, Dramatic Features and Warfield Productions
results.brief_description: James Bond author, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. The film version is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family. It stars Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe and is recreated for the screen by the director of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.

results.title: Cry freedom
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Universal Pictures and Marble Arch Productions
results.brief_description: The unforgettable friendship of two unforgettable men. The tension and the terror of South Africa is powerfully portrayed in director Richard Attenborough’s sweeping story of black activist Stephen Biko (Denzel Washington) and liberal white newspaper editor Donald Woods (Kevin Kline) who risks his life to bring Biko’s story to the world. In this explosive, emotional and thrilling film, Woods slowly learns the true horrors of apartheid through Biko’s eyes. When the South African authorities begin to view Biko as a major threat to their government, he is arrested and silenced by the police. Determined not to let Biko’s message go unheard, Woods, himself now under house arrest, undertakes a perilous quest to escape South Africa. This riveting true adventure offers a stirring account of man at his most evil and most heroic.

results.title: Watership down
results.brief_description:
One dim moonlit night, a small band of rabbits leave the comfort and safety of their warren and set out on a long and dangerous journey after a premonition of a terrible disaster that will overtake them if they stay. None of them knows where they are heading, or the dangers they will face in their search for a new warren where they can live in peace. Adapted from Richard Adams’ modern classic.
Voiced by actors including: John Hurt, Richard Briers, Ralph Richardson, Denholm Elliott, Zero Mostel, Nigel Hawthorne, Michael Hordern, Joss Ackland.

results.title: Doctor Dolittle
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This is a charming fantasy excursion which creates a wonderful world of endless imagination through music, dance and special effects. Rex Harrison stars in the madcap adventures of a 19th century English doctor who walks and talks and squawks with the animals. Based on the stories of Hugh Lofting, the good doctor gets himself into all sorts of funny predicaments in this fun film that earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture. With terrific music, fine acting, lovable creatures and a joyous fantasy tale, “Doctor Doolittle” is a classic for young and old alike.
Cast also includes: Samantha Eggar, Anthony Newley, Peter Bull and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: Pollyanna
results.brief_description: Adapted from the popular story by Eleanor Parker. Pollyanna (Hayley Mills) glows as the little orphan girl who believes that “things are always better than they seem”. She manages to change the heart of an entire town including her Aunt Polly (Jane Wyman). Judged by the public and critics alike as one of Walt Disney’s finest achievements. Pollyanna is a celebration of life. Rated G.

results.title: Silver City
results.brief_description: While travelling by train to Sydney, Nina, a teacher of Polish extraction meets a fellow Pole, Julian, whom she has not seen for many years. They recall their time at “Silver City” the camp for new Australians where they met in 1949. She was drawn to Julian from the start, it did not matter to her that he was married with a child, and they began an affair. Unable to become a teacher at this time due to her lack of qualifications, Nina takes on a job as a domestic in a country hospital. She is then transferred to a camp near Sydney where she again meets up with Julian. Together they are befriended by two Australians and begin to experience the positive side of their new lives in Australia. But when Julian returns to his wife, Nina is devastated. By 1962 she has fulfilled her desire to become a teacher, yet she remains alone.

results.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
results.creator_credit: Don Taylor, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description: Porteous betrays his love, Julia, and deceives his close friend Valentine when the two become rivals for the affections of Silvia, who flees to the forest in protest. Valentine becomes an outlaw pursued by Proteous and his page (Julia in disguise). Valentine eventually forgives his treacherous friend and marries Silvia while Proteous marries Julia.
